data.title: Career, biography and origin of George J Lewis
data.meta_description: When was celebrity George J Lewis born ? George J. Lewis was born December 10, 1903. Learn more about George J Lewis What is the origin of the personality
data.text:
George J. Lewis, real name George James Lewis, was born on December 10, 1903 in Guadalajara, Mexico. His genealogy dates back to Mexican and English origins. His father, Thomas Frederick Lewis, was of English descent, while his mother, Maria del Pilar (née Alonso y Vega), was Mexican. George Lewis also had indigenous ancestry, through his maternal grandmother. Married to Martha Putnam, he had three children: Lita Lewis, Nancy Lewis and Thomas Lewis. Growing up in an artistic family, George J. Lewis developed a love for the arts at an early age. He decided to pursue an acting career and moved to Hollywood in the 1930s.

He began his career in small roles before landing the lead role in the famous film “Zorro’s Fighting Legion” in 1939, in which he played the character of Zorro. This role contributed to his international fame and opened the doors to many other films and television series. Over the years, George J. Lewis has become one of the most prolific and respected actors in the film industry. He has worked with some of the greatest directors and shared the screen with renowned actors. His career, which spans nearly six decades, leaves an indelible mark on the history of Mexican-American cinema. George J. Lewis died on December 8, 1995, in Rancho Santa Fe, California, but his legacy lives on through his many films and his impact on the film industry.
